results.justification: The document clearly states the research methodology, focusing on a lab-based experiment and time series analysis. (e.g., "To achieve this, we conducted time series analysis (TSA) and applied statistical techniques, detailed in the subsequent sections.")

The document provides a step-by-step description of the study design, including participant recruitment, data collection (pre-test, essay writing, trace data), data processing (trace parsing), and data analysis (time series analysis, ANOVA, ANCOVA). (e.g., Sections 3.1-3.5 detail the process)
The document does not mention the public availability of the raw or processed datasets.
There is no justification provided for why the data cannot be shared.
While the document describes the variables collected (age, gender, essay scores, trace data), a comprehensive data dictionary or codebook is not provided.
Data collection methods are fully described, including the essay writing task, pre-test, and the web-based system used to collect trace data. (e.g., Section 3.2, 3.3, 3.4)
The document does not mention the availability of the analysis code in an open repository.
There is no justification provided for why the code cannot be shared.
The document mentions a trace parser and scaling function, but does not provide or mention the availability of the code used for data preparation.
Statistical tests (ANOVA, ANCOVA, Dynamic Time Warping), models, and assumptions are described. (e.g., Section 3.5, 3.5.1)
Effect sizes (η2, partial η2), p-values, and ICCs are reported. (e.g., "(𝐹(4,129) = 0.820,𝑝 = 0.514,𝜂2 = 0.025)", "ICCs > 0.85")
Subjective context and interpretation are given when describing the clusters and their associated learning strategies. (e.g., Section 4.1, 4.2)
While the process of labeling SRL processes is described, details of the data coding and analysis for the qualitative interpretation of clusters are not fully shared.
The results are clearly presented, including descriptions of the clusters, statistical test outcomes, and tables summarizing the data. (e.g., Section 4.1, 4.2, Table 1, Table 2)
Limitations related to language proficiency and the time window size are discussed. (e.g., Section 5.2)
The document does not contain a link to a preregistration.
